title: Cathie Wood Sees Bitcoin and Ethereum Coming Out of the Current Market Crisis Stronger - ZyCrypto
summary: Cathie Wood, CEO of Ark Invest, believes that Bitcoin and Ethereum will emerge from the current market crisis stronger. Despite the collapse of FTX, public blockchains like Bitcoin and Ethereum have continued to operate smoothly, highlighting their transparency, decentralization, and audibility. Wood also sees digital wallets as the next big thing, with the global crypto market wallet market expected to grow to $48.27 billion by 2030. Ark Invest has purchased more shares of Coinbase, with its total holdings valued at $408.7 million.

title: SHIBA INU Team Launch Beta L2 Blockchain Platform Shibarium Using $Bone As Native Token - Ethereum World News
summary: Shiba Inu team launches Shibarium, a beta L2 blockchain platform to lower gas fees on Ethereum. Shibarium transactions occur "off-chain" and are communicated back to Ethereum, reducing costs and faster processing times. The platform supports NFTs and has a native token, $BONE, used for gas transactions and rewards. $BONE can be obtained through ShibaSwap and other platforms, and its adoption is expected to increase as the launch of Shibarium approaches.

title: Polygon (MATIC) Bull Run As Final Testnet For Zero-Knowledge Rollups Approaches - TronWeekly
summary: Polygon (MATIC) is experiencing a bull run as the company conducts performance evaluations of its zero-knowledge roll-up technology before integrating it with the mainnet. The technology, called zkEVM, deploys the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) for zero-knowledge proofs, allowing developers to use their existing smart contracts without additional programming. The team has successfully generated over 12,000 zk-proofs in the primary version of the zkEVM testnet, with the technology poised to have a major impact on the Ethereum ecosystem by providing greater privacy and security for transactions. The price of MATIC has increased significantly, breaking through key resistance levels and reaching $0.98, with a 10% increase in the daily chart and a 23.32% increase in the weekly chart. A hard fork for Polygon is scheduled for January 17th, which could result in a potential increase in the price of MATIC.
